admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed loan and credit supports
            the inception of the second phase of rural economic reform
            in China. To achieve this broad objective, actions will be
            taken in: the following key policy areas: (a) agricultural
            and food price and trade liberalization; (b) marketing and
            market integration, (c) rural land system reform; and (d)
            rural industrialization and commercial activities. This
            project also entails actions to be taken in: (e) marketing
            and service systems in the less commercialized areas; (f)
            state-level support for public agricultural investment; and
            (g) rural financial market reforms. Typical of China's
            approach, the reforms are being introduced first at the
            regional levels under central government supervision, then
            will be generalized for nationwide implementation.
